description: Awarded several patents for his innovations in the field of electrical engineering, including the development of a new type of induction telegraph.
Developed a new type of heating system that used natural gas.
Began his work as an agricultural researcher and educator, developing new techniques for soil conservation and crop rotation that helped improve agricultural production in the southern US.
Awarded several patents for his innovations in the field of sugar refining, including the development of a new process for refining sugar using vacuum evaporation.
Made significant contributions to the field of neurosurgery and developed new techniques for the treatment of brain tumors.
Awarded several patents for his innovations in the field of transportation, including the development of a new type of steam-powered locomotive.
Became a pioneering business leader in the field of mining and one of the wealthiest African Americans in the US.
Became the second president of Tuskegee Institute, a historically Black college in Alabama, and was a leading figure in the African American education movement.
Awarded several patents for his innovations in the field of sugar refining, including the development of a new process for refining sugar using vacuum evaporation.
Awarded several patents for his innovations in the field of telecommunications, including the development of a new type of traffic signal and an early version of the gas mask.
Became the first female self-made millionaire in the US, building a successful cosmetics and hair care business for African American women.
